alert.note: Alert for Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 7:54AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Northampton, northwestern Hertford, southwestern Isle of Wight, and southeastern Southampton Counties, the City of Franklin and the central City of Suffolk through 845 AM EST... At 754 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Conway, or near Boykins, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Murfreesboro around 800 AM EST. Newsoms and Como around 805 AM EST. Franklin and Hunterdale around 815 AM EST. Holland and Carrsville around 825 AM EST. Windsor around 830 AM EST. Downtown Suffolk and Kings Fork around 835 AM EST. Suffolk around 845 AM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Suffolk Airport, Wilroy, Sunbeam, Lees Mill, Creeksville, Riverdale, Kilby, Walters and Branchville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
